etymologies: late 16th century: imitative; compare with the dialect words scamble ‘stumble’ and cramble ‘crawl’

definitions: make one's way quickly or awkwardly up a steep slope or over rough ground by using one's hands as well as one's feet

examples.text: we scrambled over the wet boulders

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: make one's way quickly or awkwardly up steep gradient

definitions: move hurriedly or clumsily from or into a particular place or position

examples.text: she scrambled out of the car
I tried to scramble to my feet

shortDefinitions: move hurriedly or clumsily from or into particular place or position

examples.text: Robbie scrambled into jeans and a T-shirt

definitions: perform (an action) or achieve (a result) hurriedly, clumsily, or with difficulty

examples.text: Cork scrambled a 1–0 win over Monaghan

shortDefinitions: perform action or achieve result hurriedly, clumsily, or with difficulty

definitions: struggle or compete with others for something in an eager or uncontrolled and undignified way

examples.text: firms scrambled to win public-sector contracts

shortDefinitions: struggle or compete with others for something in eager or uncontrolled and undignified way

definitions: order (a fighter aircraft or its pilot) to take off immediately in an emergency or for action

examples.text: the Hurricanes were scrambled again, this time meeting Italian fighters

shortDefinitions: order fighter aircraft or its pilot to take off immediately in emergency

definitions: (of a fighter aircraft or its pilot) take off immediately for action

examples.text: as the jet headed toward Italian airspace, two F104 fighters scrambled from a base in Sicily to intercept it

shortDefinitions: (of fighter aircraft or its pilot) take off for emergency action

examples.text: maybe the alcohol has scrambled his brains

definitions: prepare (eggs) by beating them with a little liquid and then cooking and stirring them gently

examples.text: you may have your eggs scrambled or boiled

shortDefinitions: cook eggs by beating them with little liquid and then cooking and stirring them gently

definitions: make (a broadcast transmission, a telephone message, or electronic data) unintelligible unless received by an appropriate decoding device
shortDefinitions: make broadcast transmission or telephone conversation unintelligible unless received by appropriate decoding device

definitions: (of a quarterback) run around with the ball behind the line of scrimmage while looking for an open receiver

examples.text: McNabb scrambled in the third quarter and threw a touchdown pass to Maddox

shortDefinitions: (of quarterback) run with ball behind line of scrimmage

definitions: run forward with the ball when unable to pass to an open receiver.
shortDefinitions: run forward with ball when unable to pass to open receiver

definitions: a difficult or hurried clamber up or over something

examples.text: an undignified scramble over the wall

shortDefinitions: difficult or hurried clamber up or over something

definitions: a walk up steep terrain involving the use of one's hands

examples.text: the route gives an excellent scramble up onto the narrow summit ridge

shortDefinitions: mountain walk up steep terrain involving use of one's hands

definitions: an eager or uncontrolled and undignified struggle with others to obtain or achieve something

examples.text: a scramble for high-priced concert seats

shortDefinitions: eager or uncontrolled and undignified struggle with others

definitions: an emergency takeoff by fighter aircraft.

examples.text: the program produced a scramble of the letters of the alphabet
